title: Ticket #6337: If USE_KEYRING_SESSIONS is on, check retval of condor_keyctl_session()
description:
We don't currently check the return value of condor_keyctl_session() which means we might be failing to actually discard keyrings when switching priv state.

This may fail because the keyring garbage collector seems to not be as aggressive as possible. In the case it fails, we sleep a tiny amount (1 microsecond) and then try again. After a default of 20 seconds, we completely give up and EXCEPT(). The number of seconds can be controlled by KEYRING_SESSION_CREATION_TIMEOUT.

Although this is technically a bug, the possibility of sleeping when changing priv state is a fairly major change in behavior, so I have targeted this for the 8.7.X developer series.
remarks:
2017-Sep-11 12:00:03 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good, would just suggest doing usleep(1000) to sleep a ms instead of usleep(1). I highly doubt the garbage collector will run within just a usec, so the code as-is is really just calling time(NULL) in a tight loop.

FWIW, no real need to call time() in the inner loop, since you could divide the timeout (20 seconds) by the sleep time (1 ms) to find out how many times to sleep before timing out.

Patch needs a version history entry, although I do not think the config knob needs to be documented (it is really just for developers).

2017-Sep-12 13:13:54 by tannenba:

Patch [52319] to address code review looks good, resolving.
